Description: Tondo and stem sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly type B, with top of narow stem; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of horse to right (head, part of hind end and hind legs missing; splotches of faded added colour on legs and faded line on underbelly); at bottom right, traces of dilute tondo band; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0647) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
